definition: half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
erhua variant of 前半天[qian2 ban4 tian1]
erhua variant of 頭半天|头半天[tou2 ban4 tian1]

sentences.english: I'm going back to ones and zeros.
sentences.chinese: 說了半天，我還是在說要學1和0。

sentences.english: I stared at the bushes for a moment without seeing anything.
sentences.chinese: 我往那叢荊棘裏盯了老半天，卻什麼也沒看見。

sentences.english: It is best to login or register first but you may post as a guest.
sentences.chinese: 只有半天時間，思前想後，還是再來六本木山一趟。

sentences.english: For all your explanation, you haven't given us the answer.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，說了半天，你也沒有爲大家揭曉答案。

sentences.english: So spacious tray, is a case -by-play of the young tourists, "Yao Tai half a day."
sentences.chinese: 這麼寬敞的塔盤，是青少年遊客戲逐的“半天瑤臺”。

sentences.english: The professor spoke for a long time, but I'm afraid his meaning did not come across.
sentences.chinese: 那教授講了半天，但我想他沒把意思講明白。

sentences.english: His grandfather roamed over the earthquake in Tangshan for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父東拉西扯地談了半天唐山的地震。

sentences.english: " See, after all, the last sentence is the core of everything he said.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，說了半天，核心內容就是最後一句。

sentences.english: I've spent half day producing this piano version.
sentences.chinese: 我花了半天製作這首歌，希望你們會喜歡我這鋼琴版。

sentences.english: Women once spent long hours grinding grain by hand.
sentences.chinese: 婦女曾經在手工研磨穀物上花上大半天的時間。

sentences.english: I am looking for a long term supplier for Facebook Fans for more projects to come.
sentences.chinese: 我找了半天的葳長期供應商來爲更多的項目。

sentences.english: We have to shake him for a long while to rouse him from his sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我們得搖晃他半天才能把他叫醒。

sentences.english: She conked off for a long time after supper.
sentences.chinese: 她在晚飯後睡了老半天。

sentences.english: Just now you talked so much.
We provide half day full English teaching with foreigner everyday.
sentences.chinese: 英文要從小抓起，肚兜提供每天半天全英文外教教學。

sentences.english: They were quarreling for a long while and quietened down at last.
sentences.chinese: 他們吵了半天，最後才安靜下來。

definition: a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
half of the day/a long time/quite a while
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
